title: Question 16
prompt: Based on this information and the excerpt from the novel, in what way might the title of the book apply to Brett and Jake’s relationship?
description:
Click the one best answer to each question.

The title of this book, The Sun Also Rises, comes from a quotation from the book of Ecclesiastes in the Bible, which describes several types of cycles: generations being born and dying, the sun coming up and down and returning to its start, and the wind and rivers moving.
feedback: The quote from Ecclesiastes talks about cycles. When it mentions the sun, it mentions the sun coming up, then going down, and finally returning to its starting point. The sun, like the wind and the rivers, moves through a cycle. Brett and Jake’s relationship seems to have been troubled. When Brett says that they “could have had such a damned good time together,” Jake doesn’t seem to believe it. Like the setting of the sun each day, perhaps troubles are unavoidable. The rising and setting of the sun is like the ups and downs of Jake and Brett’s relationship.
